result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin C Conn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid on a payment plan at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/15/2016; alternate 22 days. Payment plan fee added of $15.00.
Costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin C Conn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Impact
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 3 and count 4 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $883.00
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month to commence 05/15/2015 or  alternate of 22 days jail
Plea hearing on April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kershek requests the Court stay a capias to allow the Defendant to appear.  The State takes no position.  The Court issues but stays the capias until the next hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 03-23-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as his client needs time to complete the treatment in order to accept the state's offer. Court grants.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 01-25-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kershke moves to withdraw his Motion and requests plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing at 12-03-2015 02:30 pm
Motion hearing at 11-20-2015 01:30 pm
Defendant's Motion to Surpress (Illegal Stop)
Motion hearing at 11-11-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a motion date. Court grants the request. Matter will need 1 1/2 hours.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 09-30-2015 01:30 pm

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Benjamin C Conn did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called @ 11:25 am.  Defense counsel stated that his client thought his appearance was for 10:30 today and requets a stayed capias. State has no objections.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation this morning and return to court with their answer.  Case recalled at 10:52.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation and one will be appointed to him.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with co defendant victim/witnesss listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Benjamin C Conn in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
